Reviews.Title: “Hospitality & Comfort Abound”
Reviews.Author: TrillianTrillian
Reviews.Content: STAFF I stayed here for 9 nights with a group of colleagues on business. Being a New Yorker, I was taken aback by the sincere hospitality of the staff. They went above and far beyond the call of duty. For example, Cathy, always made sure the dinner buffet was left out and still hot for us since our hours kept us late a work each night. This was not necessary nor expected, but terribly nice and so helpful. ROOM The KITCHENETTE in the room was perfect. Included a full-size fridge, full-size coffee maker with coffee, 2 burner electric stove top, microwave, sink with dishcloth and soap, and an array of dishes, pots, and utensils. The wine glasses and corkscrew were a welcome sight. The breakfast island with two tall chairs was the perfect place to bring back my buffet items and enjoy in peace and silence before I started each day. I could have used a small hand broom and dustpan on one occasion, but there was none available. The staff will even go grocery shopping for you if you leave a list at the front desk. Awesome. The king-size BED was oh so comfy with high quality sheets that I'm used to at home. The array of pillows was nice too. Although I didn't use the LIVING AREA much, the couch and chair were comfy (couch with a pull-out bed). The television was placed just so it could be seen from the kitchen, living area, and swiveled to view from the bed...perfection. The BATHROOM area contained a large closet (bigger than my NYC apartment) with sliding doors, a sink with a very large counter-top area and large drawers below that were handy for storing 10 days worth of personal toiletries. The shower and toilet were just off the sink/closet area which was nice for two to ready themselves without delaying the other. This area was very clean and well maintained (as was the rest of the room, however no one wants a sketchy bathroom). Also contained a hair dryer and the usual toiletries. The DESK/OFFICE area was located just inside the door and had wireless internet access. The desk was a "normal" size and more than I required for a 9 day stay. Some rooms have a gas FIREPLACE. Mine did not, but it would definitely be worth asking for when you reserve a room. The VIEWS are not what you stay here for. It's an industrial-like area by the interstate. RESTAURANTS There's a Le Peep, a Starbucks, and a bar/grill (good food) called Gatsby's a 2 minute walk away. There's also a Bob Evans just across the highway that could be walked to if you are careful, but driving is probably best. POOL/HOT TUB and FITNESS CENTER There was an indoor pool and hot tub although I did not utilize these amenities. They looked clean, inviting, and well maintained. I never saw the fitness center, but it was nice knowing it was there. BREAKFAST The breakfast buffet always had a nice selection. There were hot items like eggs of various recipes (a different one each day) including Eggs Benedict, Scramble, etc. with various toppings like cheese and salsa. Also there was a meat like bacon or sausage. Various breads, pancakes, waffles, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, muffins, cereal, and biscuits with gravy. There was definitely something for everyone. My only complaint (if you can call it that) was that I wished there had been an egg white option like a hardboiled egg. EXTRAS There was a mini snack bar by the front desk where one could find the usual candy, chips, and sodas, but also frozen dinners, canned soups, and ice cream. This was convenient for late night cravings. There's a Wal-Mart and a Target (2 different exits in two different directions) within a 10 minute drive of this lovely hotel. The "breakfast area" was quite large and contained a television and gas fireplace. This space hosted my colleagues and I one night for a raucous evening of cocktails and Catch Phrase. Downtown Indianapolis is about a 20 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Average”
Reviews.Author: GHawg
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and always try to stay at Residence Inns. The Big 10 Basketball tourney was in Indy this weekend and I had to stay here as opposed to Downtown or Fishers. The room was overpriced, I pay $80 a night less for the same room at other Residence Inns. The front desk lady at check-in was wonderful, and everyone else was friendly, but not helpful. I was very disappointed with breakfast. Usually there is a varitey of foods, but not so here, the quantities and quality of what they did have was good, but I couldnt believe how few items they did have. There area isnt ideal, and we had to drive 6 miles for a decent meal. If you plan on eating out while here, bring your GPS or iPhone you will need it. I would rather stay here than some Dreary Inn, but I will go out of my way in the future to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: bill925
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at the Residence Inn in Northwest Indianapolis, and found it to be comfortable, but in need of an update. I've stayed here in the past and returned because of the staff, and great service. My business associate ended up sick during the stay, and the staff took care of him, making sure he was comfortable. Not many places will do that, but they went above and beyond. The staff are what make or break a place, and with their hospitality, it is well worth staying there. The breakfast, as well as the evening meals were good, and the chef there made sure people were happy with what they had to offer. Although it did need a facelift, that wouldn't prevent me from staying there again. With todays economy, not many properties can afford the costly facelift, so the staff makes up the difference, by offering great customer service. The property was clean and comfortable, and that is what I look for in a hotel. Would I stay there again? Yes, and I wouldn't hesitate recommending this property.

Reviews.Title: “62 on priceline”
Reviews.Author: richety
Reviews.Content: Overall ok, but seems dated inside and doesn't seem the cleanest

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed and Sad”
Reviews.Author: nvky
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this Residence Inn every year (sometimes twice a year) since it opened in 2003. It has always been my favorite Residence Inn and our stays have always been good. That being said, this year it was different. We stayed in Sept for 6 nights and again in Oct for 3 nights. The Property is getting a little weathered and is in BAD need of a remodel. Furniture, carpet, wallpaper, drapery, appliances, it all needs replacing. Bed was still comfortable but the pillows were flat and completely worn out. We had different rooms for each visit and they both did have a strange odor. (Housekeeping seems to be overlooking a lot of things that should be addressed) On our first visit the evening meal and the breakfast buffet was a joke. There was a family staying there that emptied every dish and there was never anything left for anyone else.(They never missed a meal) ( One woman took 4 big cinnamon rolls and put them in her purse) (Another family member Filled a cereal bowl full of chicken tenders) I eat alot, but that seemed a little extreme- even to me. The quality of the breakfast on the second visit was very poor until Sunday morning. (Eggs were like they had sand & ocean water in them the first two mornings) We had to eat elsewhere. This makes me SAD to write a bad review because this property used to be top notch. Not sure if we will stay here again until it is remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, big rooms, what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thriftynp78
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. The rooms are large and well-equipped. The buffet, even in the last hour of service was full of good, fresh, hot, food as well as a large selection of fresh fruit. It's location is very, very safe (I traveled with two young children and was alone most of the time with them.) The bed was comfortable and had good pillows. The sofa bed didn't look super comfortable, but my kids had no complaints! I will absolutely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business”
Reviews.Author: 2BEis2SKI
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't be terrifically interested in spending a week here but I just spent 2 nights on business and the place was fine. Room was clean and it was quiet. My only complaint was that I was on a bottom floor (by request) and it was cool at night and I wanted to open the windows but there was no screen and instead of opening only 6 inches or so for safety they opened all the way.. The area appears to be a little on the downswing with a couple closed down restaurants and if you want to go downtown, it's a 20 minute drive but it was close to where I needed to be. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Not Up to PAR!”
Reviews.Author: indygirl6666
Reviews.Content: Every year we stay here for the US Nationals in September - the past years have been great and that's why we come back. Well I must say - I was dissappointed this time around. First thing when we opened our room it smelled of smoke (I thought this was a non-smoking hotel???) Being a Non-smoker you can smell this a mile away. The first morning (we stayed 2 nights) the breakfast was good and plentiful. The 2nd morning everything ran out and the girl that was "suppose" to be replenishing was still cooking stuff in the back and she looked like she just crawled out of bed too. We decided to go to Bob Evans across the street that morning. Because of these 2 instances, we will not return here again.

Reviews.Title: “not up to par........”
Reviews.Author: butlinz
Reviews.Content: Generally i like Residence Inns.....whether business or leisure travel. BUT they have to be managed and staffed adequately - like any hotel. THIS one needed help. No one at front desk to check me in.....they poor soul flying solo that nite was too busy prepping breakfast things - i had to find her! (before 10pm? Aw c;mon!) They stuck me in a "handicapped access" room with a door that even the incredible Hulk would have had to strain to open on his own.....and the whole wing STANK of vomit. (Hint - a few puffs of a room smoke-deodorizer might have worked well) Breakfast at 8am was a case of 'where did everything go?' - obviously there had been a passable selection but all snapped up and no replenishment. Checkout was fast, efficient. Internet was ok, Room (aside from stuck door) - was ok....clean at least. Bed comfy. AC ok. Your experience may be better - i hope so, - i called AND wrote Marriott on my unhappy stay here.....having said that, one of my colleagues was equally dischuffed in their overniter last week and moved to the Hilton property nearby. That's where i'll go next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: olliel02
Reviews.Content: Staff was awesome. Great hot breakfast and social hrs Monday-Thursday. Includes free beer and wine. Rooms are clean and really feel like you are at home. Staff goes above and beyond to accomodate your every need. Can't say enough good things!!! We will definately stay here again when in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: Camabap
Reviews.Content: As a Race Fan, I've been on another gr8 Residence Inn in Indy Area (Carmel). I Pick this one cause it's closest to Speedway than the Carmel one. The Staff is simply fantastic, I love the way they treat you like a family member, not a guest. The room is big, very clean. The Mattress is confortable, good kitchen, decent bathroom. We have free hi speed internet access, LCD TV. The breakfast is wonderful. If you're coming to Indianapolis, this is your place....a place to call home!

Reviews.Title: “It Reminds me of Public Housing”
Reviews.Author: r-me-chap-e
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Residence Inns and I would consider this the worst. There was mildew on the back of the curtains. The breakfast was free, but mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you are in Indy for business,I'd find another place”
Reviews.Author: nevadaexile
Reviews.Content: Not a "bad" Residence Inn,but just not close to anything. And it's hard to find (and I know Indy well) And it's easy to get lost going back to it at night. The room was clean,the Internet worked (although NOT the wireless) and it was quiet I had Rewards points and I used them for my stay,but if I had to PAY to stay,I would suggest either the Downtown or the NE Indy locations. Both are near to restaurants and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Second Review, Much the Same”
Reviews.Author: tgsapo
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Residence Inn Northwest Indianapolis. Much of my previous review is still applicable. This hotel is good for business travelers who need to be in the area. It is located in an industrial area with few attractions nearby. The nearest grocery store is approximately 2 miles away. I would not recommend it for visitors who want to experience the culture of Indianapolis. It provides a good value in the form of a free continental breakfast, large rooms, free evening appetizers, and decent amenities. The continental breakfast provided hot items like eggs and sausage, as well as an assortment of cereals, breads, yogurts, fruits, coffee, and juices. My room was located on the third floor, very large, clean, and quiet. I did not eat any of the evening appetizers. The pool was decent-sized. The gym had two treadmills, an elliptical, exercise bike, and crunch bench, but no disinfectant or cleaning supplies, which made me question the room's hygiene. There was a computer for internet access in the lobby, but the connection was very slow. WIFI was available The service was hit or miss. For the most part, the employees were friendly and accommodating. However, one female in particular seemed more interested in fraternizing with the male maintenance employees than providing service to the customers or hotel. I also saw some of the maintenance employees browsing the internet from the lobby computer. I would stay here again for the hotel's value and the Marriot rewards program. Don't expect a five-star experience, but at least you'll get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of Road Experience”
Reviews.Author: rggsquared
Reviews.Content: Hotel is middle-aged but well kept. Breakfast was ok, pretty much ordinary Residence Inn quality and selection. I stayed here one week for a business meeting. I participated in the evening reception once and food was again..well..ordinary. Decided to eat off-site the remainder of my stay. I am Marriott Gold and travel frequently and the bottomline for this Residence Inn is...well..ordinary. Nothing wrong with the experience just nothing special either.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better place”
Reviews.Author: GoGreen2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in one of the two room suites. It was like my own little apartment. There were little touches that added to the comfort of my stay. The free continental breakfast was amazing. Pretty much covered it all and I was so full from it that when lunch came around I wasn't even that hungry. During the week they had free food in the evenings and even free adult beverages. This saved money on having to go out to a restaurant to eat. The staff was really friendly, I loved my stay here and I would be happy to stay again. It's very close to many restaurants, bars, and shopping. The Indiana State Fair was about a 5 min drive from here as well. Also the conference center was within walking distance. I highly recommend this place, it was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MsIowa
Reviews.Content: This place was excellent for a little over $100! There was a kitchen with a full sized frig, a garbage disposal, dish washer, and they will even grocery shop for you if you take them a list by 8 am! We had a living room area with a couch and chair and then a bedroom area. The breakfast was free with biscuits and gravy, scrabbled eggs, and the normal breakfast foods at hotels. We stayed one night but wanted to move in. If you are in this area can't pass this up!

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable business travel”
Reviews.Author: torp
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when I am in Indy for business. It is very close to my destination, and provides a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, reasonably comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: My family and some friends stayed here for the night of Friday, August 24th. I used my Marriott points to pay for the friends and got the gov per diem rate for my family ($93). The front desk staff was efficient and friendly. They did a great job giving driving directions to my friends who were driving in from another state. The location was convenient to I-65 and I-465, which allowed easy access to downtown Indianapolis. The rooms were clean and comfortable. My friends needed a rollaway bed, which was delivered promptly. The regular bedding was very comfortable as well. The pool was well maintained and a great place for our kids to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: arabella31
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! I stayed there for a couple of months while working in Indianapolis. The hotel has some of the nicest and most gracious staff I've ever encountered! They went out of their way to make sure I was satisfied with my stay there and even made sure I got my nightly snack (even if I told them I would be a little late returning). My room was very pleasant. I've stayed at Residence Inns all over the country but this one was my favorite, mainly because of the staff. I'm looking forward to returning there when I have some leisure time!

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Indianapolis Northwest
HotelInfo.Address: 6220 Digital Way, Indianapolis, IN 46278
